idea-plugin.name: GitBot Commit
idea-plugin.description:
GitBot Commit generates AI commit messages directly from your staged changes, integrated into the IntelliJ IDEA Git Commit workflow.

How it works:
Click the ⚡ AI Commit action in the Commit UI. GitBot reads your staged diff (git diff --cached), sends it to an AI model via OpenRouter, and writes a structured commit message following the Conventional Commits style.

Features:
  • Generates commit messages from staged changes
  • Conventional Commits style: feat, fix, refactor, docs, chore, test, style
  • Supports output language: English and Brazilian Portuguese
  • Compatible with any OpenRouter model (default is configurable in Settings)
  • Fully customizable prompt templates, with reset to defaults
  • Runs in background with progress indication and cancellation support
  • Secure API key storage using the IDE credential store
Requirements:
  • An OpenRouter API key
  • IntelliJ IDEA with Git enabled
  • Staged changes (the plugin uses git diff --cached)
Getting Started:
Go to Settings → GitBot Commit, set your OpenRouter API key, model, language, and prompts. Then open the Commit UI and run ⚡ AI Commit.

License: MIT.
Source Code: github.com/frshaka/GitBotCommitPlugin
